This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor"},"getManagerIdentity()":{"returns":{"_managerIdentity":"The address of the current manager"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. :["bzz-raw://7a61054ae84cd6c4d04c0c4450ba1d6de41e27e0a2c4f1bcdf58f796b401c609","dweb:/ipfs/QmUvtdp7X1mRVyC3CsHrtPbgoqWaXHp3S1ZR24tpAQYJWM"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable/contracts/utils/ContextUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xdbef5f0c787055227243a7318ef74c8a5a1108ca3a07f2b3a00ef67769e1e397","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://08e39f23d5b4692f9a40803e53a8156b72b4c1f9902a88cd65ba964db103dab9","dweb:/ipfs/QmPKn6EYDgpga7KtpkA8wV2yJCYGMtc9K4LkJfhKX2RVSV"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable/contracts/utils/introspection/ERC165Upgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc8ed8d2056934b7675b695dec032f2920c2f5c6cf33a17ca85650940675323ab","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3c8ccc75d1cd792d192aa09e54dd49ea35fe85baa9fcd17486f29227d9f29b89","dweb:/ipfs/QmbboSbFUEiM9tdEgBwuTRb7bykFoJXZ7dsSr1PSREJXMr"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/IAccessControl.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc1c2a7f1563b77050dc6d507db9f4ada5d042c1f6a9ddbffdc49c77cdc0a1606","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://fd54abb96a6156d9a761f6fdad1d3004bc48d2d4fce47f40a3f91a7ae83fc3a1","dweb:/ipfs/QmUrFSGkTDJ7WaZ6qPVVe3Gn5uN2viPb7x7QQ35UX4DofX"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x79796192ec90263f21b464d5bc90b777a525971d3de8232be80d9c4f9fb353b8","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f6fda447a62815e8064f47eff0dd1cf58d9207ad69b5d32280f8d7ed1d1e4621","dweb:/ipfs/QmfDRc7pxfaXB2Dh9np5Uf29Na3pQ7tafRS684wd3GLjVL"]},"src/V0/ArianeeLost.sol":{"keccak256":"0x11fede4fe1bc513e021247abb91864bfb2b1530b4c9d2fcc6934ff1c24a6df1b","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://83b84d2e3de9105f64c113e39920339496247aee856b721d3dedd2617b069d87","dweb:/ipfs/Qmb3zsnCHSCh6JnP4C4X8gsUGr4yStzzXZMyWidWuJSSr5"]},"src/V0/Constants.sol":{"keccak256":"0x00956059b5c3ee2a97af7a9fd33a78de3667274790e1a81357642d0a41b02452","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ba19f3eea19b59b6b2b6c904fe20b56162599c4227d8d57bc2b41e2d9ca7890e","dweb:/ipfs/QmRjihJTPqR4WhZM73WvVL8BFhfiYyobrErwJ6xTUDG5CK"]},"src/V0/Interfaces/IArianeeLost.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf1392f35959a0efe38aa17166fef5ea3191d0953d9f2b31728141d91977f7fe0","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c2f8188a3e05ff3336a50df58dfbb2a27c20427af0cf71d3008c4b0135a6407f","dweb:/ipfs/QmPokwjK5obLrne9NDSwupduT3nwaBxTS7JUAFoiNPKhpQ"]},"src/V0/Interfaces/IArianeeSmartAsset.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5d6be645aedc95fd0508671647b27fef1576036f9c6a5b3ab24bb5466fe519ad","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://cec9fa7dcff849ef0c4c6216e6777b371319938bb2095b9560996c2986767f11","dweb:/ipfs/QmawZPTXfPJ4HUiMgcToxcr1hpgvBg9YgzQR9BZCPc3bzS"]}},"version":1}

returns._managerIdentity: The address of the current manager

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._isAuthorized: True if the address is authorized, false otherwise

returns._isMissing: True if the SmartAsset is marked as missing, false otherwise

returns._isStolen: True if the SmartAsset is marked as stolen, false otherwise

isTrustedForwarder(address).details: Indicates whether any particular address is the trusted forwarder.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setAuthorizedIdentity(address).details: Can only be called by the manager

setManagerIdentity(address).details: Can only be called by the contract owner

setMissingStatus(uint256).details: This can only be called by the SmartAsset owner and the SmartAsset must not already be marked as missing

setStolenStatus(uint256).details: Can only be called by an authorized identity, and the SmartAsset must be marked as missing

trustedForwarder().details: Returns the address of the trusted forwarder.

unsetAuthorizedIdentity(address).details: Can only be called by the manager

unsetMissingStatus(uint256).details: This can only be called by the SmartAsset owner, and the SmartAsset must currently be marked as missing

unsetStolenStatus(uint256).details: Can only be called by the manager or the identity that initially marked the SmartAsset as stolen

isAddressAuthorized(address).notice: Checks if an address is authorized to manage stolen statuses

isMissing(uint256).notice: Returns whether the SmartAsset is marked as missing

isStolen(uint256).notice: Returns whether the SmartAsset is marked as stolen

setAuthorizedIdentity(address).notice: Adds a new authorized identity to manage stolen statuses

setManagerIdentity(address).notice: Sets the manager identity for the contract

setMissingStatus(uint256).notice: Sets the missing status for the given SmartAsset ID

setStolenStatus(uint256).notice: Marks the given SmartAsset as stolen

unsetAuthorizedIdentity(address).notice: Removes an authorized identity from managing stolen statuses

unsetMissingStatus(uint256).notice: Unsets the missing status for the given SmartAsset ID

unsetStolenStatus(uint256).notice: Removes the stolen status from the given SmartAsset ID

@notice Emitted when a new manager identity is set by the contract owner
@notice Emitted when a SmartAsset is declared missing by its owner
@notice Emitted when a SmartAsset is declared no longer missing by its owner
@notice Emitted when the manager adds a new authorized identity
@notice Emitted when the manager removes an authorized identity
@notice Emitted when an authorized identity declares a SmartAsset as stolen
@notice Emitted when an authorized identity declares a SmartAsset as no longer stolen
